alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 10:51AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Miami-Dade and southern Broward Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1050 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Park, or near Hallandale, moving northeast around 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miami, Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Hallandale, Miami Gardens, Lauderhill, North Miami, North Miami Beach, Aventura, Dania Beach, Cooper City, Sunny Isles Beach, Opa-Locka, West Park and Miami Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Miami. You can also share your report with NWS Miami on Facebook and Twitter.
